name: Grilled Mahi-Mahi, Ceviche-Style
headline: Grilled Mahi-Mahi, Ceviche-Style
keywords: Memorial Day Recipes,Jalapeno Recipes,Fruit,Lime Recipes,Onion Recipes,Fish,Mahi Mahi Recipes,Main Dish,Lunch,Grilling,Marinating Recipes,Gluten Free,Low-Fat

recipeInstructions.text: Rub the fillets with kosher salt and set aside. In a non-reactive bowl, combine the onion, lime juice, orange juice, jalapeno, sugar and tequila. Mix to dissolve the sugar, and add the fillets to the bowl. Marinate in the refrigerator for 2 hours, turning the fillets once after 1 hour. Remove the fillets from the marinade and set it aside. Pat the fillets dry with paper towels and lightly coat with the olive oil.

Heat a grill to high and place the fillets over direct heat until they are just cooked through - opaque at the center but still moist, approximately 3 to 4 minutes per side. While the fish is grilling, transfer the reserved marinade to a saucepan and heat until it is reduced to about 3/4 cup. Using tongs, remove the fillets to serving plates and divide sauce equally among them. Top with the cilantro.

review.reviewBody: My wife's comment... "Restaurant quality!!!" Simply delicious one of my go to recipes!
I thought it was the worst recipe I've had in a long time. I was very disappointed with the marinade sauce I ended up pouring down the drain. Sorry Alton it just wasn't good.

We absolutely loved this fish and the recipe is a definite keeper.  We're going to Hawaii in a couple months and we'll be making this there.  I also felt it was a restaurant quality recipe and don't understand the few negative reviews.
Oh my gosh, good!

My husband and I didn't like it. Way too sweet. Masqued the flavor of the fish.  And, it couldn't have been fresher, because we caught it in the late morning!!  I think it would have been much better without the brown sugar and orange juice.  Ceviche style is acidic and not sweet.  Sorry, Alton - I love most recipes I try of yours - this one missed the mark.

Excellent. I used frozen mahi and it was delicious. My husband said it was restaurant quality. (We eat at really good restaurants.
It was simple and quick to prepare. I'm adding it yo my regulars.

My husband is super picky right now trying to eat less red meat and chicken and more fish - but so picky!  He absolutely loved this! We also made Kelsey's quinoa recipe with the coconut milk and lime juice and it was so yummy!  I agree that the fresh cilantro really makes it.  I also put some fresh cilantro in the quinoa too.  You have to try this!

I never grilled fish before so this was a little intimidating at first to me. I couldn't find fresh Mahi Mahi in my area so I went with Atlantic Salmon filets instead. It turned out better than I expected and I even had a friend eating it(and she hates fish. She bragged to her mother about how wonderful it was(also hates fishand she talked me into making it again. Needless to say I had it twice within three days. Awesome recipe! And super easy!

I've been making this recipe for years now and everyone I serve it to just loves it.  The sprinkle of cilantro before serving makes it!  I've shared the recipe with my friends and family and it is now my husband's favorite fish dish, you've got to try it because once you do, it will be a regular in your cooking repertoire.
This dish was really easy to make and delicious. It was very tasty, will be on my list of favorite.

I found this recipe rather bland and the dish a lackluster eating experience.  That said, I think fish, in general, requires a little bolder flavors than other foods.  If you like spicy, bold, or a rich flavor profile I think you will be disappointed in this one.
Very good!!!
Super simple and delicious.  A definite keeper in my recipe box!

I found the marinade odd, did not taste good at all. I followed
the directions perfectly. Will never use tequila in a marinade ever.
This is an easy and delicious recipe.  I have made it with several different kinds of fish and it always comes out great!
This was delicious! I added 2T of orange marmalade to the sauce to sweeten it a bit for the kids. I didn't thicken the sauce enough but it still tasted great.

I made this for dinner tonight exactly as it's written and it was delicious! Interestingly, one of my favorite parts was the marinated onions in the sauce. One tip that I think Alton would agree with: use FRESH fish! Mine was in the fridge for one night and already the corners were dry and fishy smelling/tasting. My fault, though, and it was still an amazing piece of fish.
I made this at the beach with fresh mahi mahi and it was a hit with everyone! Super easy and tasty!
I added chopped mango to the Marinade. Loved it!
This was awfu!

A recommended recipe.  Since I was out of red onions, I doubled up on the white onions.  Since I had Don Julio (gold) tequila and I doubled up on the orange juice to offset the strong drink. It turned out to be soooooo good. I included grilled peppers and zuccini in the works. I also made fried rice (garlic, green onions with orange zest on top).  My family cleaned up their plate.  Surely, we will make this recipe again.

I made this for my daughters graduation party. I had never had mahi mahi before and this was a HUGE hit. Everyone loved it. Not too hot and not too sweet--just right. Look forward to making it again in the near future for my family.
Good Eats!!

This is by far my husbands dish, he constantly begs me to make it for him, it has such great flavor, and when you add extra jalapeno it gives it that extra kick.  I am cooking it tonight for dinner again!!  Thanks Alton for a great recipe.

Never had ceviche before, but when I saw it was also grilled, had to try it.
It was delicious...knew we could count on Alton!

I knew this was going to be good just reading the recipe...my husband wasn't so sure...He was pleasantly surprised....as was I at his overwhelming  support of this new way to have one of our favorite fishes.

The fish is very moist, and marinating is a must.  I could eat the fish without the final sauce but it makes it even better.  Served over a bed of pasta and it is so good.  I recommend every one to buy his book for all the recipes from the show.  It also has so much information on every day ingredients.

This dish was very simple to prepare and didn't require any exotic ingredients.  The fish stayed moist and the sauce made from the marinade was fantastic.  The sprinkle of the fresh cilantro really topped things off, giving it a fresh, summertime finish.  I used a little extra jalapeno to give it just a bit more spice.

I've made this fish several times now, and it is always tender and moist. After removing from the grill, I put the cooked sauce over the fish (turning a couple of times) and let it sit for a few minutes. The fish absorbs some of the sauce again and is very flavorful.

One time, I had some left over pineapple juice and chipotle peppers, so I subsitiuted these for the orange juice and jalepeno. Tasted great too.
My husband and I both loved this dish.  I cooked it on a cedar plank on the grill.

I thought the fish came out too bland.  Without the sauce it wasn't good at all.  I was expecting the sauce with the jalapenos (that I increased the amount of) to have a bit more of a kick but it did not at all.
The amount of flavor in this dish is unbelievable.  Outstanding!!!!!  The fish was moist and very flavorful, the sauce took it over the top - to the moon.  LOVED IT!!!

This is one of the BEST recipes for Mahi! The sauce is incredible! The dish is very easy to complete and looks very professional when it is done. I actually only cooked one pound of Mahi (so we had plenty of sauce!) When I make it again I will use 2lbs (and will probably make extra sauce!!).  Goes great with rice and veggies!! The fresh cilantro at the end makes it PERFECT!!

This dish is perfect for cooks that are not so skilled, although I am, this dish is "The Bomb"! If you have someone coming over and you want to grill but don't have a lot of time, you can show off your skills with this dish. Prep it the day before or early that day and when the guest arrive pop it on the grill and sit back and watch them melt. I let my co-worker try it because he doesn't like fishy fishes and he fell in love with it. GREAT DISH. good deal, good eats man!!!

I made this recipe simply because I had all the ingredients on hand...WOW...my family could not have been more impressed!  Beautiful presentation, the flavors complimented the Mahi-Mahi to perfection and it was soooo easy to prepare for the grill.  I had fresh asparagus, red and yellow peppers and red onions added on the grill with some lemon, olive oil and herbs brushed on them to round out the meal with tricolor orzo...so FESTIVE!!!
Loved this! Perfect recipe for summer and fairly easy to put together.

Alton's recipes are the best.  This fish has the most amazing taste.  The reduced sauce/marinade is a must...don't skip!   I served the mahi mahi with wasabi mashed potatoes and lima beans...perfecto!

I tried this for Thanksgiving, as I don't eat turkey, sadly the store was out of mahi mahi so I made it with talapia...not my favorite of the fish world. The flavors though, were wonderful; moist, and tangy... and pouring a bit of the ceviche on top just brought the flavor out even more, a wonderful dish. Also, if you have some of the limes and brown sugar left over they make a wonderful complement to a shot of tequila.
This was an easy way to add a new flavor to your table. I added just a little to much Jalapeno, but other wise the meal was excellent. We added some carrots cooked with sweet basil as a side

I put this recipe together in no time! It was a hit with my husband...it is so flavorful and moist, you almost forget you are having fish for dinner! I will make this over and over again--it is awesome!
Loved, loved, loved this recipe.  I didn't have tequila (not a favorite of mine) so I used rum instead and it was great.  Very easy and fresh tasting - my husband especially enjoyed the sauce.
Easy and a crowd pleaser even folks who don't like fish like this!
Just a little too sweet
This was the best Mahi Mahi my husband and I have ever had, and we eat alot of fish out and in. And soooo easy, Alton you really nailed this one.
This was so easy and so tasty and light. Perfect for a summer dinner party. While the fish was grilling I added chopped mango to the marinade and reduced it to a really great sauce.
We followed the recipe exactly.  This was superb.
I made this for my husband (who is not a vegetarian) and he loved it.  I tried it under duress and I liked it too.  Perhaps i'll have to expand my horizons.
My husband and I both thought this was great! Very flavorful combination of ingredients. Served it with some rice and Giada's grilled vegetable recipe which was awesome too.
I used this marinade pre-grilling and it was very flavorfull.  The combo of the Tequila and sugar was fantastic.

I have never been much of a fish fan.  But I decided to give it a try.  This recipe caught my eye and I thought I would give it whirl.  It's very tasty.  The fish has a mild flavor to it, but the ceviche sauce on top was very tasty.  I recommend rice as a nice accoutrement to the Mahi-Mahi.  Plus it is tasty with the sauce.
